se.sics.jasper

Class IllegalTermException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • se.sics.jasper.SPException
          • se.sics.jasper.IllegalTermException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, PrologException

    public class IllegalTermException
extends SPException
    Thrown if trying to use a (no longer) valid SPTerm.

    You should not create or inherit from IllegalTermException.

    You should not catch an IllegalTermException. Catch SPException instead, since IllegalTermException is not guaranteed to exist in future versions of Jasper.

    See Also:
    SPTerm.isValid(), Serialized Form
